intro: Borreria exserta, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and woolly, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. Borreria exserta is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. It is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic to some animals.
